alert.note: Alert for Henderson; Transylvania (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 25 at 3:46PM EDT until March 26 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in North Carolina... French Broad River At Blantyre affecting Transylvania and Henderson Counties. .Periods of moderate to heavy rain on Wednesday resulted in storm-total accumulations of 3-5 inches, with isolated totals approaching 6 inches, across the upper French Broad River watershed. This heavy rainfall caused significant rises along the upper French Broad River, from Rosman, to Brevard, Blantyre, Horse Shoe, Fletcher, and Avery Creek. The upper French Broad River exceeded Minor Flood Stage near Blantyre and Action/Advisory Stage at Fletcher, causing nuisance to Minor flooding of adjacent low-lying, flood-prone areas including farmland, woodlands, parks, greenways, river-access areas, and a few secondary roads and driveways. The French Broad River is expected to remain out of its banks into Saturday morning, with conditions improving by Saturday afternoon. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...French Broad River At Blantyre. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Action Stage. Most farm fields are flooding between the French Broad River and Brevard Rd. and between the French Broad River and Pleasant Grove Rd. At 16.0 feet, Minor Flood Stage. Farmland flooding continues on both sides of the French Broad River. Floodwaters begin to impact boat access areas at Grove Bridge Rd. and Crab Creek Rd. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:16 PM EDT Friday the stage was 16.7 feet and falling steadily. - The French Broad River at Blantyre crested at 17.20 ft on Thursday at 10:20pm. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below Minor Flood Stage tonight, below Action/Advisory Stage later overnight, and continue falling to 10 feet by Sunday afternoon. - Minor Flood Stage is 16.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. For detailed information including observed and forecast stages, flood impacts, flood history, FEMA Flood Hazard Layers, and more, please visit: https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=gsp
